page.title: 03DUNVANT VILLAGE
page.content: From a thriving industrial village at the turn of the century,the village has become a solely residential area since the closure of the last coal mine in 1924.It was not until the 1950's and I960's that a rapid growth in housing development took place.Many of the new residents had been moved to this area to form the nucleus of staff at newly opened factories,such as 3M's and Ford's.Many of the new residents have taken a keen interest in local activities and jealously guard what remains of the rural aspect.This is demonstrated by the current opposition to a proposed housing development on what was farmland until 1984.One of the fears is that the intervening farmland between Dunvant and Three Crosses will also disappear in time,the area losing its individuality in an extension of Swansea's suburbia.
